discussion.p: This issue is extracted as the ongoing point-of-interest from earlier issue .

auto_ptr is overspecified as the auto_ptr_ref implementation detail is formally specified, and the technique is observable so workarounds for compiler defects can cause a working implementation of the primary auto_ptr template become non-conforming.
auto_ptr_ref is a documentation aid to describe a possible mechanism to implement the class. It should be marked exposition only, as per similar classes, e.g., istreambuf_iterator::proxy

blockquote.p: I wonder, whether the revised wording shouldn't be as straight as for istream_buf by adding one further sentence:
An implementation is permitted to provide equivalent functionality without providing a class with this name.

discussion.note: 2009-11-06 Alisdair adds Daniel's suggestion to the proposed wording.
2009-11-14 Moved to Tentatively Ready after 5 positive votes on c++std-lib.

resolution.p: Add the term "exposition only" in the following two places:

blockquote.p: The exposition only class Ttemplate auto_ptr_ref holds a reference to an auto_ptr. It is used by the auto_ptr conversions to allow auto_ptr objects to be passed to and returned from functions. An implementation is permitted to provide equivalent functionality without providing a class with this name.

blockquote.pre: namespace std { template <class Y> struct auto_ptr_ref { }; // exposition only
